title: Who decided that black people would be known as African Americans? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I don’t think it has been decided. Some people are into the Hyphenated-American thing. Some black people want to get back to their African roots but, for most, that’s not really possible. Black Americans have lived here for several centuries as have many whites and have no idea where there ancestors lived and what their culture was like. I think the hyphenated-American thing is a product of identity politics and is not of much use to Americans other than those who are descended from more recent migrations and can actually identify their origins. Black Americans have a lot more in common, culturally, with white Americans than their African ancestors. I use the term Black people based upon the notion that “Black is Beautiful”. I prefer to just refer to us all as Americans unless there is some compelling need to make a distinction.
